<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Risky Surgery](/Feats.aspx?ID=2146) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 208 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9)

</column>

---

Your surgery can bring a patient back from the brink of death, but might push them over the edge. When you [Treat Wounds](/Actions.aspx?ID=57), you can deal 1d8 slashing damage to your patient just before applying the effects of Treat Wounds. If you do, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) check to Treat Wounds, and if you roll a success, you get a critical success instead.
name: Risky Surgery
